text: Charles M. Rice (born August 25, 1952) is an American virologist. His main area of research is hepatitis C virus. He is a professor of virology at the Rockefeller University. He was born in Sacramento, California. Rice is a Fellow of the American Association for the Advancement of Science, member of the National Academy of Sciences and was president of the American Society for Virology from 2002 to 2003. Along with Michael Houghton and Harvey J. Alter, he was awarded the 2020 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:Living people Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:People from Sacramento, California Category:Scientists from California Category:American virologists Category:Rockefeller University faculty
